# High Throughput Computing on HPC Systems


## HTC
- Many work items
- independent from one another
- "moderate" walltime per item

## Example
- Monte Carlo simulation
- Multi-dimensional parameter survey

## Tools
- Job arrays (e.g. PBS, Slurm)
- Worker-ng, atools (developed at VSC)

::: {.callout-tip .fragment}
Details are covered in the 'Workflows for HPC' training
:::

##

```{.bash filename="monte-carlo.slurm"}
#!/usr/bin/env -S bash -l                     # <1>
#SBATCH --account=lpt2_sysadmin               # <2>
#SBATCH --nodes=1 --ntasks=1                  # <3>
#SBATCH --cpus-per-task=1                     # <4>
#SBATCH --time=00:02:00                       # <5>
#SBATCH --cluster=wice --partition=batch      # <6>
#SBATCH --array=1-256                         # <7>

module purge &> /dev/null                     # <8>
module load SciPy-bundle/2024.05-gfbf-2024a   # <9>

python mcmc.py --seed=$SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID   # <10>
```
